ygData.subject: Re: possible big cheat for EQ....
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Now that would be a big exploit. Its the client who tells you if you can or cannot hit a mob so it might be possible to change the mobs position in client
ygData.messageBody:
Dmitry M. Devishev wrote:

> From: "Dmitry M. Devishev" <dmitry@...>
>
> Hi!
>
> > Actually, there is one important thing that is handled completely on the
> > client side. That is, where you are in the world. (Proof, sit in a spot,
> > unplug your ethernet cable from the back of your PC, run 1000 spaces,
> > plug it back in, see that you're still there and not at the other place.)
> > So it should be possible to modify the X/Y/Z location in the client and
> > have that information passed on to the server...
>
> I also believe what targeting happens only on client side. If client is
> notified about monster (update has been sent from server what such
> monster exists) you can target it without server check. Afaik targeting
> in EQ uses bounding boxes tracing, and im sure it is made by client, not
> server. So, because you can shoot your DDs through walls and monsters in
> most cases cannot move through walls, it can be ultimate cheating.
> Target any monster in dungeon on client, and nuke him from behind a wall
> without any opposition. Of course, server do not send ALL monsters in
> zone to client, so you dont know their IDs and cannot target them at
> all, but you possible can target any mob in ~30 meters radius.

Now that would be a big exploit. Its the client who tells you if you can or cannot hit a mob
so it might be possible to change the mobs position in client side only... like make them
all appear just in your face (sure, only the ones you know the ID).. done that you can
cast / hit them from far away...

its even possible to tell you the mob distance... like when you /con a mob you get an extra
message
saying the mob distance so you know if you can actually kill the mob before it even reach you or
not.

I dont know if EQ have the mechanics (however its spelled) to avoid this kind of cheat...
they could send sanity checks asking/sending to the clients lots of stuff to avoid this kind
of cheat but that would increase lag. Seems to me that Verant relies all their protection
(against this kind of cheat) in dont allowing you to ALT-TAB, which is a good protection
but not the best... if you have anything running between you and the server as I mentioned
before you really dont need to ALT-TAB. you can create your own commands that only
your program understand and do not send to the server... lemme see what could be done
easily...

/ultravision on/off
/rain start/stop
/sow on/off -> As someone mentioned before maybe the server dont have sanity checks
to see if you are moving too fast... the server might trust the client too much in this aspect of
the game
/levitate on/off
/clipping on/off -> it would allow you to move through walls just like quake
/breath on/off -> would let you breath underwater... did you EVER notice that the air indicator is
NEVER
affected by lag ? Maybe the server trust the client too much in this....
/casting_time seconds -> this one would never work , the server is the one that control casting
time =)

well I could give examples forever... some of this wouldnt work but I BET some would work...

again, Verant rely most of their security dont allowing you to ALT-TAB, and they trust too much
in EQ client =P

BUT I can be completely wrong anyway =)

I just think the game is too fun and no one is bored enough to start coding
